question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure the code you generate is executable when displayed. Help me create a real-time data display for stock limit-up monitoring in a TongHuaShun-style format. It should be in HTML format with a window interface and have an attractive design.

checklist.title: Is the real-time stock data display system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements real-time stock data fetching and display through HTML/JavaScript, including stock price updates, percentage changes, volume data, and limit-up detection logic. Score 0 if core data display is not implemented, 5 if only basic price display is shown, and 10 if comprehensive stock metrics including limit-up alerts are fully integrated.

checklist.title: Is the TongHuaShun-style interface design authentically replicated?
checklist.description: Check whether the interface design follows TongHuaShun's characteristic layout including: data grid tables, color-coded price changes (red for up, green for down), professional financial dashboard appearance, and appropriate use of financial industry UI conventions. Deduct 5 points if the visual style doesn't match professional trading platforms, and 3 points if color coding doesn't follow market standards. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the limit-up monitoring mechanism properly designed with alert functionality?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the system includes accurate limit-up detection (typically 10% increase for most stocks, 20% for ST stocks), real-time monitoring with visual/audio alerts, and filtering capabilities for limit-up stocks. Deduct 5 points if limit-up calculation is incorrect, 3 points if no alert mechanism exists, and 2 points if filtering is not implemented. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the window interface system complete with proper interaction controls?
checklist.description: Check whether the code implements a complete windowed interface with resizable panels, sortable columns, search/filter functionality, and proper window management (minimize, maximize, close). Deduct 5 points if window controls are missing, 3 points if tables are not sortable, and 2 points if search functionality is absent. Give 10 points if fully implemented with smooth window operations.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as API failures, network interruption, invalid stock data, real-time data feed errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the trading experience (e.g., 1. Real-time candlestick mini-charts 2. Sound alerts for limit-up events 3. Historical limit-up statistics 4. Custom watchlist management 5. Export functionality for limit-up data). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple data fetching mechanisms coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to stock monitoring (e.g., built-in games or social features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations during data updates). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core financial data display is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data fetching/display/alert logic), proper error handling, and clean code structure. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if data processing is inefficient for real-time updates. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional financial design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows professional trading platform principles: 1) Appropriate use of financial industry colors (red/green for gains/losses) 2) Clear data hierarchy with proper spacing (follows 8px grid system) 3) Professional typography (monospace fonts for numbers, readable font sizes â‰¥ 12px for data tables). Deduct 3 points for each unclear data presentation, 5 points for unprofessional color schemes, and 5 points for poor data table formatting. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the real-time data update smooth and performant?
checklist.description: Judge whether the real-time updates are optimized for performance: 1) Data refresh rate appropriate for stock monitoring (1-3 seconds) 2) Smooth transitions without flickering during updates 3) Efficient DOM manipulation to prevent lag 4) Proper handling of high-frequency data streams. Deduct 5 points for each performance bottleneck, 3 points for visual glitches during updates, and 5 points for slow response to limit-up events. The full score is 10 points.
